info.description:
Codat's Banking API allows you to access standardised data from over bank accounts via third party providers.

Standardize how you connect to your customersâ€™ bank accounts. Retrieve bank account and bank transaction data in the same way via our partnerships with Plaid and TrueLayer.

[Read more...](https://docs.codat.io/banking-api/overview)

[See our OpenAPI spec](https://github.com/codatio/oas)
info.summary: Codat's standardized API for accessing banking data.
info.title: Banking API

tags.description: Where payments are made or received, and bank transactions are recorded.
tags.name: Accounts

tags.description: Balances for a bank account including end-of-day batch balance or running balances per transaction.
tags.name: Account balances

tags.description: An immutable source of up-to-date information on income and expenditure.
tags.name: Transactions

tags.description: Hierarchical categories associated with a transaction for greater contextual meaning to transaction activity.
tags.name: Transaction categories

get.description: Gets a list of balances for a bank account including end-of-day batch balance or running balances per transaction.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).
parameters.name: pageSize

accountId.description: The unique identifier of the account.

balance.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

balance.title: Account Balance Amounts

date.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
date.title: Date time

modifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
modifiedDate.title: Date time

sourceModifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date time

accountBalanceAmounts.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

accountBalanceAmounts.title: Account Balance Amounts

items.description:
The Banking Account Balances data type provides a list of balances for a bank account including end-of-day batch balance or running balances per transaction.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

> **How often should I pull Account Balances?**
>
> Because these balances are closing balances, we recommend you pull Account Balance no more frequently than daily. If you require a live intraday balance, this can be found for each account on the [Account](https://docs.codat.io/banking-api#/schemas/Account) data type.
> 
> Whilst you can choose to sync hourly, this may incur usage charges from Plaid or TrueLayer.
items.title: Account Balance

get.description: Gets a list of all bank accounts of the SMB, with rich data like balances, account numbers and institutions holdingthe accounts.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).
parameters.name: pageSize

balance.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

balance.title: Account Balance Amounts

currency.description: The currency code for the account.

holder.description: The name of the person or company who holds the account.

id.description: The ID of the account from the provider.

identifiers.description: An object containing bank account identification information.

bankCode.description:
The local (usually national) routing number for the account.

This is known by different names in different countries:
* BSB code (Australia)
* routing number (Canada, USA)
* sort code (UK)

bic.description: The ISO 9362 code (commonly called SWIFT code, SWIFT-BIC or BIC) for the account.

iban.description: The international bank account number (IBAN) for the account, if known.

maskedAccountNumber.description: A portion of the actual account `number` to help account identification where number is tokenised (Plaid only)

number.description: The account number for the account. When combined with the`bankCode`, this is usually enough to uniquely identify an account within a jurisdiction.

identifiers.title: Account Identifiers

informalName.description: The friendly name of the account, chosen by the holder. This may not have been set by the account holder and therefore is not always available.

institution.description: The bank or other financial institution providing the account.

id.description: The institution's ID, according to the provider.

name.description: The institution's name, according to the underlying provider.

institution.title: Account Institution

name.description: The name of the account according to the provider.

type.description:
The type of transactions and balances on the account.  
For Credit accounts, positive balances are liabilities, and positive transactions **reduce** liabilities.  
For Debit accounts, positive balances are assets, and positive transactions **increase** assets.
type.title: Bank Account Type

modifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
modifiedDate.title: Date time

sourceModifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. sourceModifiedDate.title: Date time

items.description:
This data type provides a list of all the SMB's bank accounts, with rich data like balances, account numbers, and institutions holding the accounts.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-accounts).

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

schema.description:
This data type provides a list of all the SMB's bank accounts, with rich data like balances, account numbers, and institutions holding the accounts.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-accounts).

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.
schema.title: Account

get.description: Gets a list of hierarchical categories associated with a transaction for greater contextual meaning to transactionactivity.

parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).
parameters.name: pageSize

allOf.description: Status of the bank transaction category.

hasChildren.description: A Boolean indicating whether there are other bank transaction categories beneath this one in the hierarchy.

id.description: The unique identifier of the bank transaction category.

name.description: The name of the bank transaction category.

parentId.description: The unique identifier of the parent bank transaction category.

modifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.

transactionCategoryRef.description: An object of bank transaction category reference data.

id.description: The unique category reference id for the bank transaction.

name.description: The category name reference for the bank transaction.

items.description:
The Banking Transaction Categories data type provides a list of hierarchical categories associated with a transaction for greater contextual meaning to transaction activity.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

items.description:
The Banking Transactions data type provides an immutable source of up-to-date information on income and expenditure.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

View the coverage for banking transactions in the [Data Coverage Explorer](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-transactions).

schema.title: Transaction

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for a transaction
parameters.name: transactionId

schema.description: Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

get.description: Gets a list of transactions incurred by a company across all bank accounts.

parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).
parameters.name: pageSize

accountId.description: The unique identifier of the bank account.

amount.description: The amount of the bank transaction.

authorizedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
authorizedDate.title: Date time

code.description: Code to identify the underlying transaction.

currency.description: The currency of the bank transaction.

description.description: The description of the bank transaction.

id.description: The unique identifier of the bank transaction.

postedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
postedDate.title: Date time

transactionCategoryRef.description: An object of bank transaction category reference data.

id.description: The unique category reference id for the bank transaction.

name.description: The category name reference for the bank transaction.

modifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
modifiedDate.title: Date time

sourceModifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date time

transactionCode.description: Code to identify the underlying transaction.

items.description:
The Banking Transactions data type provides an immutable source of up-to-date information on income and expenditure.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

View the coverage for banking transactions in the [Data Coverage Explorer](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-transactions).
items.title: Transaction

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

pageSize.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).
pageSize.name: pageSize

balance.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

balance.title: Account Balance Amounts

currency.description: The currency code for the account.

holder.description: The name of the person or company who holds the account.

id.description: The ID of the account from the provider.

identifiers.description: An object containing bank account identification information.

bankCode.description:
The local (usually national) routing number for the account.

This is known by different names in different countries:
* BSB code (Australia)
* routing number (Canada, USA)
* sort code (UK)

bic.description: The ISO 9362 code (commonly called SWIFT code, SWIFT-BIC or BIC) for the account.

iban.description: The international bank account number (IBAN) for the account, if known.

maskedAccountNumber.description: A portion of the actual account `number` to help account identification where number is tokenised (Plaid only)

number.description: The account number for the account. When combined with the`bankCode`, this is usually enough to uniquely identify an account within a jurisdiction.

identifiers.title: Account Identifiers

informalName.description: The friendly name of the account, chosen by the holder. This may not have been set by the account holder and therefore is not always available.

institution.description: The bank or other financial institution providing the account.

id.description: The institution's ID, according to the provider.

name.description: The institution's name, according to the underlying provider.

institution.title: Account Institution

name.description: The name of the account according to the provider.

type.description:
The type of transactions and balances on the account.  
For Credit accounts, positive balances are liabilities, and positive transactions **reduce** liabilities.  
For Debit accounts, positive balances are assets, and positive transactions **increase** assets.
type.title: Bank Account Type

modifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.

Account.description:
This data type provides a list of all the SMB's bank accounts, with rich data like balances, account numbers, and institutions holding the accounts.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-accounts).

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.
Account.title: Account

accountId.description: The unique identifier of the account.

balance.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

balance.title: Account Balance Amounts

date.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
date.title: Date time

Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date time

accountBalanceAmounts.description: Depending on the data provided by the underlying bank, not all balances are always available.

available.description: The balance available in the account, including any pending transactions. This doesn't include additional funds available from any overdrafts.

current.description: The balance of the account only including cleared transactions.

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

accountBalanceAmounts.title: Account Balance Amounts

AccountBalance.description:
The Banking Account Balances data type provides a list of balances for a bank account including end-of-day batch balance or running balances per transaction.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

> **How often should I pull Account Balances?**
>
> Because these balances are closing balances, we recommend you pull Account Balance no more frequently than daily. If you require a live intraday balance, this can be found for each account on the [Account](https://docs.codat.io/banking-api#/schemas/Account) data type.
> 
> Whilst you can choose to sync hourly, this may incur usage charges from Plaid or TrueLayer.
AccountBalance.title: Account Balance

limit.description: The minimum allowed balance for the account. For example, a $100.00 overdraft would show as a limit of `-100.00`.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

> **How often should I pull Account Balances?**

sourceModifiedDate.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date time

transactionCode.description: Code to identify the underlying transaction.

Transaction.description:
The Banking Transactions data type provides an immutable source of up-to-date information on income and expenditure.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.

View the coverage for banking transactions in the [Data Coverage Explorer](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/banking?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=banking-transactions).
Transaction.title: Transaction

allOf.description: Status of the bank transaction category.

hasChildren.description: A Boolean indicating whether there are other bank transaction categories beneath this one in the hierarchy.

id.description: The unique identifier of the bank transaction category.

name.description: The name of the bank transaction category.

parentId.description: The unique identifier of the parent bank transaction category.

items.description:
The Banking Transaction Categories data type provides a list of hierarchical categories associated with a transaction for greater contextual meaning to transaction activity.

Responses are paged, so you should provide `page` and `pageSize` query parameters in your request.
